title: Justice for J6 rally
deleted: <<!--Prior to the event, -->Braynard downplayed the estimated size of the rally and criticized the security measures established in response to the event, saying they were designed to discourage and deter participants.<ref name=USAToday.Bullhorn>{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2021/09/17/justice-j-6-organizer-ex-trump-staffer-election-fraud-promoter/8379295002/|title='Might just be me and a bullhorn': Meet the unlikely organizer of the Justice for J6 rally in DC|publisher=USA Today|last1=Jansen|first1=Bart|last2=Carless|first2=Will|last3=Johnson|first3=Kevin|last4=Rouan|first4=Rick|date=September 17, 2021|accessdate=September 18, 2021}}</ref> In response to the planned rally, Former U.S. President [[Donald Trump]] called it a "setup" for Republican voters, saying, "If people don't show up they'll say, 'Oh, it's a lack of spirit.' And if people do show up they'll be harassed."<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.politico.com/news/2021/09/16/trump-justice-j6-setup-capitol-512260|title=Trump calls upcoming 'Justice for J6' rally a 'setup'|publisher=Politico|last=Ward|first=Myah|date=September 16, 2021|accessdate=September 18, 2021}}</ref> Republicans have distanced themselves from the demonstration.<ref>{{Cite news|last=Broadwater|first=Luke|date=2021-09-15|title=Republicans, Wary of Political Fallout, Steer Clear of Rally for Riot Suspects|language=en-US|work=The New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2021/09/15/us/politics/republicans-justice-for-j6-rally.html|access-date=2021-09-18|issn=0362-4331}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Lejeune|first=Tristan|date=2021-09-18|title=Republicans keep distance from 'Justice for J6' rally|url=https://thehill.com/homenews/house/572805-republicans-keep-distance-from-justice-for-j6-rally|url-status=live|access-date=2021-09-18|website=The Hill|language=en}}</ref> On social media, far-right groups like the [[Proud Boys]] were urging members not to attend the event.<ref name=USAToday.Bullhorn/>

title: Justice for J6 rally
added: {{Excerpt|Criminal charges brought in the 2021 United States Capitol attack|paragraph=1|hat=no}}<!--You can edit the first paragraph of this section here:

title: Justice for J6 rally
added: A man arrested at the event who was found to be in possession of a knife.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2021/09/18/justice-j-6-updates-live-dc-rally-supporting-capitol-rioters/8338765002/|title=Rally for Capitol riot suspects draws small crowd of protestors amid heavy security|publisher=USA Today|date=18 September 2021|accessdate=18 September 2021}}<?ref> Another was found to be possession of a gun.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/live-updates/justice-for-j6/?id=80019940|title='Justice for J6' updates: Rally concludes without any known major incidents|publisher=ABC News|date=September 18, 2021|accessdate=September 18, 2021}}</ref>

title: Justice for J6 rally
added: A man arrested at the event who was found to be in possession of a knife.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2021/09/18/justice-j-6-updates-live-dc-rally-supporting-capitol-rioters/8338765002/|title=Rally for Capitol riot suspects draws small crowd of protestors amid heavy security|publisher=USA Today|date=18 September 2021|accessdate=18 September 2021}}</ref> Another was found to be possession of a gun.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/live-updates/justice-for-j6/?id=80019940|title='Justice for J6' updates: Rally concludes without any known major incidents|publisher=ABC News|date=September 18, 2021|accessdate=September 18, 2021}}</ref>

title: Justice for J6 rally
added: Among the speakers at the rally was Joe Kent, who is challenging [[Jaime Herrera Beutler]], and Mike Collins, who is running for [[Georgia's 10th congressional district]].<ref>https://www.wral.com/right-wing-groups-protest-political-prisoners-arrested-after-jan-6-insurrection/19882767/</ref>

title: Justice for J6 rally
added: Among the speakers at the rally was Joe Kent, who is challenging Washington stateU.S.Congresswoman [[Jaime Herrera Beutler]], and Mike Collins, who is running for [[Georgia's 10th congressional district]].<ref>https://www.wral.com/right-wing-groups-protest-political-prisoners-arrested-after-jan-6-insurrection/19882767/</ref>

title: Justice for J6 rally
deleted: In April 2021, both Senate Majority Whip Dick Durbin (D-IL) and Senator Elizabeth Warren (D-MA) had denounced the treatment of the January 6th prisoners as abusive: “Solitary confinement is a form of punishment that is cruel and psychologically damaging,” Warren said, adding: “And we’re talking about people who haven’t been convicted of anything yet.” Warren also stated that she was “worried that law enforcement officials are deploying it to ‘punish’ the Jan. 6 defendants or to ‘break them so that they will cooperate.” Durbin added that such conditions should be a “rare exception."<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.politico.com/news/2021/04/19/capitol-riot-defendants-warren-483125|title=Jan. 6 defendants win unlikely Dem champions as they face harsh detainment|publisher=Politico|last1=Cheney|first1=Kyle|last2=Desiderio|first2=Andrew|last3=Gerstein|first3=Josh|date=April 19, 2021|accessdate=October 20, 2021|url-status=live}}</ref>

In August, a rally titled "Justice for J6", organized by Look Ahead America, a [[Nonprofit organization|nonprofit]] led by former Trump campaign staffer Matt Braynard, was scheduled to be held on the grounds of the U.S. Capitol starting at 12:00 p.m. [[Eastern Time Zone|ET]] on September 18. The rally was intended as a show of support for people charged for participating in the attack. Lawmakers and law enforcement officials expressed their concerns over possible unrest at the rally.<ref name="bckgrnd1">{{cite news|url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/08/27/politics/renewed-fears-of-political-violence-grip-capitol-hill/index.html|title=Renewed fears of political violence grip Capitol Hill ahead of right-wing rally|publisher=CNN|last1=Zanona|first1=Melanie|last2=Wild|first2=Whitney|date=August 27, 2021|accessdate=September 6, 2021|archive-date=September 7, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210907145754/https://www.cnn.com/2021/08/27/politics/renewed-fears-of-political-violence-grip-capitol-hill/index.html|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name="bckgrnd2">{{Cite news|last=LeBlanc|first=Paul|date=September 15, 2021|title=Here's everything we know about the September 18 right-wing rally in DC|work=CNN|url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/09/15/politics/september-18-rally-capitol-security-explainer/index.html|access-date=September 16, 2021|archive-date=September 16, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210916102524/https://www.cnn.com/2021/09/15/politics/september-18-rally-capitol-security-explainer/index.html|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name="bckgrnd3">{{cite news|url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/09/06/politics/september-18-rally-dc-andrew-mccabe-cnntv/index.html|title=Ex-FBI official says law enforcement needs to take upcoming right-wing rally in DC 'very seriously'|publisher=CNN|last=LeBlanc|first=Paul|date=September 6, 2021|accessdate=September 6, 2021|archive-date=September 7, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210907025246/https://www.cnn.com/2021/09/06/politics/september-18-rally-dc-andrew-mccabe-cnntv/index.html|url-status=live}}</ref>{{sp}}</onlyinclude>

title: Justice for J6 rally
deleted: In August, the [[Justice for J6 rally]] was organized by Look Ahead America, a [[Nonprofit organization|nonprofit]] led by former Trump campaign staffer Matt Braynard, was scheduled to be held on the grounds of the U.S. Capitol starting at 12:00 p.m. [[Eastern Time Zone|ET]] on September 18. The rally was intended as a show of support for people charged for participating in the attack. Lawmakers and law enforcement officials expressed their concerns over possible unrest at the rally.<ref name="bckgrnd1">{{cite news|url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/08/27/politics/renewed-fears-of-political-violence-grip-capitol-hill/index.html|title=Renewed fears of political violence grip Capitol Hill ahead of right-wing rally|publisher=CNN|last1=Zanona|first1=Melanie|last2=Wild|first2=Whitney|date=August 27, 2021|accessdate=September 6, 2021|archive-date=September 7, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210907145754/https://www.cnn.com/2021/08/27/politics/renewed-fears-of-political-violence-grip-capitol-hill/index.html|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name="bckgrnd2">{{Cite news|last=LeBlanc|first=Paul|date=September 15, 2021|title=Here's everything we know about the September 18 right-wing rally in DC|work=CNN|url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/09/15/politics/september-18-rally-capitol-security-explainer/index.html|access-date=September 16, 2021|archive-date=September 16, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210916102524/https://www.cnn.com/2021/09/15/politics/september-18-rally-capitol-security-explainer/index.html|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name="bckgrnd3">{{cite news|url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/09/06/politics/september-18-rally-dc-andrew-mccabe-cnntv/index.html|title=Ex-FBI official says law enforcement needs to take upcoming right-wing rally in DC 'very seriously'|publisher=CNN|last=LeBlanc|first=Paul|date=September 6, 2021|accessdate=September 6, 2021|archive-date=September 7, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210907025246/https://www.cnn.com/2021/09/06/politics/september-18-rally-dc-andrew-mccabe-cnntv/index.html|url-status=live}}</ref>{{sp}}</onlyinclude>

title: Justice for J6 rally
added: Since the Justice for J6 rally, A DC judge inquired about the treatment of January 6th protestors. Once this inquiry went unfulfilled, District Judge Royce Lamberth held the warden in contempt. On October 18th, 2021, United States Marshalls visited D.C.'s Central Detention Facility to witness first hand the conditions of alleged January 6th protestors. <ref>{{Cite web|title=US marshals inspect DC jail and speak with Jan. 6 inmates|url=https://news.yahoo.com/us-marshals-inspect-dc-jail-210600746.html|access-date=2021-10-20|website=news.yahoo.com|language=en-US}}</ref>

title: Justice for J6 rally
added: Matt Braynard  stated in interviews that the rally is “100% about #JusticeforJ6 and not the election or any candidate."<ref>{{cite news|url=https://thehill.com/policy/national-security/572268-sept-18-rally-organizer-asks-attendees-not-to-wear-pro-trump|title=Sept. 18 rally organizer asks attendees not to wear pro-Trump clothing|publisher=The Hill|last=Schnell|first=Mychael|date=September 14, 2021|accessdate=October 22, 2021}}</ref>. The official Look Ahead America website discouraged attendees from wearing political gear, stating "Do not wear or bring political, candidate, or another organization’s paraphernalia. This includes clothing or banners supportive of President Trump or President Biden."<ref>https://lookaheadamerica.org/rally/</ref>

title: Justice for J6 rally
added: Both during and after the September 18th rally, Look Ahead America had rallies in 17 other states.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://heavy.com/news/justice-for-j6-time-locations-map/|title=Justice for J6 Rally Time, Locations & Map: Where Will the Protests Be?|author=Stephanie Dube Dwilson|publisher=Heavy|date=September 18, 2021|accessdate=October 25, 2021}}</ref><ref>https://lookaheadamerica.org/rally/</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2021/sep/10/us-capitol-rally-organizers-look-expand-13-states/|title=U.S. Capitol rally organizers look to expand protests to 13 state capitals|author=Emily Zantow|publisher=The Washington Times|date=September 10, 2021|accessdate=October 25, 2021}}</ref> Two were held on the same day as the rally: Charlotte, North Carolina and Seattle, Washington. <ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/dc-md-va/2021/09/18/justice-j6-rally-capitol-riot-dc/|title=‘Justice for J6’ rally starts and ends with small crowds and tight security|authors=Emily Davies, Marissa J. Lang, Katie Mettler, and Peter Jamison|publisher=The Washington Post|date=September 18, 2021|accessdate=October 25, 2021}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.wcnc.com/article/news/nation-world/justice-for-j6-rally-charlotte-north-carolina/275-edcc484c-2c5b-4382-ba3d-bc11f5687f5b|title=Charlotte group among 18 protests across U.S. rallying for those arrested after Capitol riot|publisher=WCNC Charlotte|date=September 18, 2021|accessdate=October 25, 2021}}</ref> The 15 other state rallies occurred in Arizona,<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.azmirror.com/2021/09/25/arizona-justice-for-j6-rally-draws-small-crowd-of-extremists-gop-officials/|title=Arizona ‘Justice for J6’ rally draws small crowd of extremists, GOP officials|author=Jerod MacDonald-Evoy|publisher=AZ Mirror|date=September 25, 2021|accessdate=October 25, 2021}}</ref> California, Colorado,<ref>{{cite 2021|accessdate=October 25, 2021}}</ref> Georgia,<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.fox5atlanta.com/news/justice-for-january-6th-rally-held-at-georgia-state-capitol|title='Justice for January 6th Rally'
